intro: Argostemma bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
